intro: Gentiana pumila, commonly known as the dwarf gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often hairy. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a common sight in woodland habitats. The flowers are rich in nectar and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
